text: You cast for 4 AP and 5 Mana and summon forth a Combat Tier 1 elemental from one of the four prime elemental planes.
The elemental follows your mental commands, but you can only command it if you're able to perceive it.
The summon disappears after 1 minute, until it is slain, or until you dismiss it.
If your Upkeep is interrupted, or if you chose to relinquish control over the elemental, the elemental goes rogue.
As a result, you can not command it anymore, and it starts attacking indiscriminately.
A summoned elemental that has become rogue stays until the spell runs out.
When you gain higher ranks of this spell, you can use those spell variations to summon a single elemental of a higher tier, or an amount of elementals of a lower rank in steps of two.
For example, with the rank 3 spell, you can summon one Tier 3 elemental, two Tier 2 elementals or four Tier 1 elementals.
For {{conditionalText[0]}} Mana, you can summon a Combat Tier {{newRank}} elemental, or an amount of lower Tier elementals equals to {{conditionalText[1]}} Tier 1 elementals.
